meaningMnemonic:
A <kanji>hand</kanji> <kanji>paper</kanji> is a <vocabulary>letter</vocabulary> because letters are generally written by hand on paper.

If you want a more graphic image, imagine writing a letter on your hand, and how much it would hurt to chop off your hand and send it.
readingMnemonic: The reading is double kun'yomi. Think of 手紙 as two words mashed together — a letter is a thing you write by hand (て) on paper (かみ). You've learned those readings already, so you should be able to read this! Just watch out for the rendaku on がみ.
